intro: Tagetes rotundifolia, commonly known as Mexican marigold or roundleaf marigold, is a species of flowering plant in the sunflower family, Asteraceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers and round, velvety leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil and full sun. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes and is also used in traditional medicine. The leaves and flowers are sometimes used in culinary applications, though they are generally less common than other marigold varieties.
